Package cards

Class BlueCard

java.lang.Object
cards.Card
cards.BlueCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComputerRepair, F1Race, LawsuitBlue, SalaryTaxDue, SkiAccident, TipTheServer, WorldCup
public abstract class BlueCard
extends Card
Abstract class providing a skeletal implementation of blue card, which asks the player to either collect money from the Bank or pay money to another player or the Bank depending on whether the career specified in the card matches that of the player or of the other players.

A blue card is picked whenever the player ends up on a blue space.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int AMOUNT_GAIN
    Amount collected by the player from the Bank if his/her career matches the career specified in this card, indicated in the machine project specifications as $15000
    static int MATCHED_CAREER
    Flag value indicating that the career match of the blue card matches the player's career
    static int NO_MATCH
    Flag value indicating that the career match of the blue card does not match the career of any of the active players
    static int OTHER_MATCH
    Flag value indicating that the career match of the blue card matches another player's career

    abstract java.lang.String getInfoBank()
    Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player pays money to the bank
    abstract java.lang.String getInfoMatch()
    Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player's career matches the career specified in the card (i.e., they will collect money from the bank)
    abstract java.lang.String getInfoOtherPlayer()
    Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player pays money to another player

  • Constructor Details

    • BlueCard

      public BlueCard​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String careerMatch)
      Constructor with the specified name of this card and career as parameters

      The name of a blue card is indicative of the action or event it specifies (for example, Ski Accident, Tip the Server, etc.).

      Parameters:
      name - name of this card
      careerMatch - career specified in this card

  • Method Details

    • getCareerMatch

      public java.lang.String getCareerMatch()
      Returns the career specified in this card
      Returns:
      career specified in this card

    • isMatchedCareer

      public boolean isMatchedCareer​(java.lang.String career)
      Returns true if the given career is the same as the career specified in this card; false, otherwise

      More formally, it performs a case-insensitive string matching to determine if given career is the same as the career specified in the card.

      Parameters:
      career - career which will be checked if it matches the career specified in this card
      Returns:
      true if the given career matches the career specified in this card; false, otherwise

    • executeMatchedCareer

      public void executeMatchedCareer​(Player currPlayer, Bank b)
      Executes the effect of the blue card when the current player's career matches the specified career match of the card

      Specifically, if the player's career matches the specified career on the card, they will collect 15000 from the Bank.

      Parameters:
      currPlayer - current player with turn
      b - Bank of the game

    • getInfoBank

      public abstract java.lang.String getInfoBank()
      Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player pays money to the bank

      As the prompts vary depending on the card, its details are implemented in the seven subclasses of the BlueCard class.

      Returns:
      string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player pays money to the bank

    • getInfoMatch

      public abstract java.lang.String getInfoMatch()
      Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player's career matches the career specified in the card (i.e., they will collect money from the bank)

      As the prompts vary depending on the card, its details are implemented in the seven subclasses of the BlueCard class.

      Returns:
      string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player's career matches the career specified in the card

    • getInfoOtherPlayer

      public abstract java.lang.String getInfoOtherPlayer()
      Abstract method for returning the string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player pays money to another player

      As the prompts vary depending on the card, its details are implemented in the seven subclasses of the BlueCard class.

      Returns:
      string to be used as a prompt in the actual gameplay when the player pays money to another player

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this card, which includes its name and specified career

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Type of card (Blue Card)
      • Specified career
      • Name of the card (for example, Tip the Server, Ski Accident, etc.)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Card
      Returns:
      string representation of this card, which includes its name and specified career
